sentence.Network_en: He thumped the lectern as he spoke.
sentence.Network_cn: 他边讲道边用手捶打读经台.

sentence.Network_en: Behind the crude lectern, off to a side, stands a curtained puppet theatre.
sentence.Network_cn: 在粗糙的读经台后面, 偏向一边, 是一座挂着幕布的木偶戏台.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French letrun, from medieval Latin lectrum, from legere 'to read'

entry.def: A lectern is a high sloping desk on which someone puts their notes when they are standing up and giving a lecture.

means.word_mean: 1. desk or stand with a slanted top used to hold a text at the proper height for a lecturer

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表形容词,"……方向的"; 2. 表名词,"……场所"

stems_affixes.word_buile: east东+ern……方向的→adj.东方的,东部的
northeast东北+ern……方向的→adj.东北方的,来自东北的
north北+ern……方向的→adj.北方的,北部的
northwest西北+ern……方向的→adj.西北方的,来自西北的
south南+ern……方向的→adj.南方的,南部的
southwest西南+ern……方向的→adj.西南的,来自西南的
west西+ern……方向的→adj.西方的,西部的
cist箱子+ern……场所→n.[抽水马桶的]贮水池
lect讲话+ern……场所→n.[教堂中的]诵经台
